intro: Gynandropsis gracilis, commonly known as the slender gynandropsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in compact heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
